result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate w/o Consent-Abandon Veh

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasper Hang

records.addlTxt:
10:21 a.m.  State's inducement letter of 7/15/22.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline:  10/28/22, 8:30 a.m.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

$300.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.   
Notice to Party Furnishing Cash Bail Bond. 
--Lue Hang, 2359 S. 18th Street, Manitowoc, WI  54220
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matters are continued for preliminary hearing on 9-2-22 at 10:00 am in Branch 3.  The previously furnished recognizance bond is modified to $300 cash with all prior conditions. Cash bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody. Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Warrant served.
Defendant in custody at BCSO.
WARRANT FEES: $123.97
Request and Response Regarding Open Records - mailed 07-26-2022
2:19 p.m.  Non-appearance by defendant for preliminary hearing.  Warrant issued on State's motion.  NOPD.  Adj. 2:20 p.m.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

1:51 pm - Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kasper Hang in court.  Attorney Claire Elisabeth Barth in court for Kasper Hang. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing is set for 07-15-22 at 1:30 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on July 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
